greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of representations of n as a sum of products of pairs of positive integers >=2, n = Sum_{k=1..m} i_k*j_k with 2<=i_k<=j_k, i_k<=i_{k+1}, j_k<=j_{k+1}, i_k*j_k<=i_{k+1}*j_{k+1}.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
example: a(17) = 1 = A182270(17)-1, one of the 2 sums counted by A182270(17) is not allowed: 17 = 2*4 + 3*3.
maple: b:= proc(n, m, i, j) option remember;
add(b(n-m, m, min(i, k), min(j, m/k)), k=select(x->
is(x>1 and x<=min(sqrt(m), i) and m<=j*x), divisors(m))))))
mathematica: b[n_, m_, i_, j_] := b[n, m, i, j] = If[n == 0, 1, If[m < 4, 0, b[n, m - 1, i, j] + If[m > n, 0, Sum[b[n - m, m, Min[i, k], Min[j, m/k]], {k, Select[ Divisors[m], # > 1 && # <= Min[Sqrt[m], i] && m <= j*# &]}]]]]; a[n_] := b[n, n, n, n]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 30}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 23 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 06 2012
